Detailed Description

Vertex weights for a poser joint binding.

Member Function Documentation

void DzWeightMap::beginEdit (  )  [virtual, slot]

Begin an edit on this weight map's data.

void DzWeightMap::cancelEdit (  )  [virtual, slot]

Cancel an edit on this weight map's data. When called, the weight map's data is set back to its original state and the undo items created in the beginEdit() call are destroyed.

void DzWeightMap::empty (  )  [slot]

Empties the weight map and frees the data for the vertex weight array.

void DzWeightMap::finishEdit (  )  [virtual, slot]

Finish the current edit on this weight map's data. When called, the undo items created in the beginEdit() call will be finalized and pushed on to the undo stack.

unsigned short DzWeightMap::floatToWeight ( float  val  )  [static]

Convenience function to convert from a float value to a weight value. The given weight will be clamped to the range of [0.0, 1.0] before conversion.

Returns:
The value of the weight mapped from the range of [0.0, 1.0].

DzError DzWeightMap::normalizeMaps ( DzWeightMapList &  weightMaps,
bool  respectLocking = false 
) [static]

Normalizes the maps in the given list so that that the sum of the weights in all maps at a given index is equal to DZ_USHORT_MAX. The weight maps must all have the same number of weights, or the operation will fail. Normalization is performed on a prioritized basis, with maps at the front of the list having the highest priority, i.e. the weights in the maps nearest the end of the list will be subtracted from, weights in the maps nearest the front of the list will be added to to make the sum of the weights equal to DZ_USHORT_MAX. For weights where all the maps in the list are zero, the full weight will be added to the last map in the list.

Parameters:
weightMaps The list of maps to normalize.
respectLocking Defines whether locked map state will be respected.
DzError DzWeightMap::normalizeMaps ( DzWeightMapList &  weightMaps,
DzWeightMap *  priority,
DzWeightMap *  def = NULL,
bool  respectLocking = false 
) [static]

Normalizes the maps in the given list along with the priority map so that that the sum of the weights in all maps at a given index is equal to DZ_USHORT_MAX. The weight maps must all have the same number of weights, or the operation will fail. Normalization is performed on a prioritized basis, with priority having the highest priority and the maps in the list having equal priority - i.e. the weights in the maps in weightMaps will be added to or subtracted from to make the sum of the weights equal to DZ_USHORT_MAX, the priority map is not changed. For weights where all the maps in the list are zero, any remaining weight will be added to the def map - if def is NULL, the remaining weight is added to the priority map - this is the only case where weights in the priority map will change.

Parameters:
weightMaps The list of maps to normalize.
priority The map which has the highest priority.
def The map which receives the weight if no other map in the list has a weight value, if NULL, the priority map recieves the weight. If not NULL, this must be one of the maps in the weightMaps list.
respectLocking Defines whether locked map state will be respected.
DzError DzWeightMap::normalizeMapsWithSymmetry ( DzWeightMapList &  weightMaps,
DzWeightMap *  priority,
DzWeightMap *  symMap,
DzWeightMap *  def = NULL,
bool  respectLocking = false 
) [static]

Normalizes the maps in the given list along with the priority map so that that the sum of the weights in all maps at a given index is equal to DZ_USHORT_MAX. The weight maps must all have the same number of weights, or the operation will fail. Normalization is performed on a prioritized basis, with priority having the highest priority and the maps in the list having equal priority - i.e. the weights in the maps in weightMaps will be added to or subtracted from to make the sum of the weights equal to DZ_USHORT_MAX, the priority map is not changed. For weights where all the maps in the list are zero, any remaining weight will be added to the def map - if def is NULL, the remaining weight is added to the priority map - this is the only case where weights in the priority map will change.

Parameters:
weightMaps The list of maps to normalize.
priority The map which has the highest priority.
symMap The map that is in symmetry witht he priority map. If the priority map does not weight a vertex the symmetry map is checked next. In that case it behaves as the priority.
def The map which receives the weight if no other map in the list has a weight value, if NULL, the priority map receives the weight. If not NULL, this must be one of the maps in the weightMaps list.
respectLocking Defines whether locked map state will be respected.

Performs any post-processing actions needed after a file has been loaded.

bool  keepExisting = false

unsigned short  value

float DzWeightMap::weightToFloat ( unsigned short  weight  )  [static]

Convenience function to convert from a weight value to a float.
